learning_styles.title: Visual Learners
learning_styles.description: Visual learners absorb information best through images, diagrams, and spatial organization. They excel when concepts are presented visually, such as through charts, graphs, or infographics.

learning_styles.title: Reading/Writing Learners
learning_styles.description: Reading/Writing learners prefer written text and excel  at engaging with written materials. They often take detailed notes, read extensively, and express ideas through writing.

learning_styles.title: Auditory Learners
learning_styles.description: Auditory learners thrive when information is presented verbally. They benefit from listening to lectures, discussions, and audio-based materials like podcasts or recordings.

learning_styles.title: Kinesthetic Learners
learning_styles.description: Kinesthetic learners learn best through hands-on activities and physical engagement. They excel in environments where they can interact with materials,  perform experiments, or apply concepts in real-world scenarios.

note_taking.title: Cornell Notes
note_taking.description: A structured note-taking method with three sections: cues, notes, and a summary.

note_taking.title: Sketchnotes
note_taking.description: A creative method that combines text with doodles, icons, and visuals to capture ideas.

note_taking.title: Mind Maps
note_taking.description: A visual diagram that organizes information around a central idea, with branches for related concepts.

note_taking.title: Outlines
note_taking.description: A hierarchical method that uses bullet points and subpoints to organize information logically.
